meanings.definition: An unintended consequence or result of an action.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected repercussion of skipping breakfast was feeling very hungry later.
meanings.sent2: The company did not anticipate the repercussions of their decision to downsize.
meanings.sent3: The mix-up at the party had a funny repercussion - everyone ended up dancing to the wrong song.
meanings.sent4: The repercussions of his lie echoed through the office, affecting trust among coworkers.
meanings.sent5: The student learned the repercussion of not studying for the test when he received a failing grade.

meanings.definition: The recoil or reverberation of sound.
meanings.sent1: The loud repercussion of the drum echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: The gunshot's repercussion startled the birds in the trees.
meanings.sent3: The repercussion of the singer's high note made the audience cover their ears in mock pain.
meanings.sent4: The repercussion of the thunder could be felt in the vibrations of the floor.
meanings.sent5: The repercussion of the church bell was so strong, it could be heard miles away.
